text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Maltese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Maltese court starts hearing case of Libyan refugee wanted by Libya. The refugee, Nagib Harari, told the court he forms part of a political organisation seeking change in the Libyan leadership. Harari was arrested in Malta on Friday on his way to Sweden, where he had been granted asylum. Libya says he is wanted for drug trafficking.
- Government announces wide-ranging police reform. The reform aimed at modernising the management structure of the police.

- Nationalist Party orders transmitter for own television station. The party, in opposition after nine years in government, is planning to set up its own TV station but is still awaiting government licences.
